title: American_Top_40_1973_May_19th
description:
"You're listening to the most popular songs from the Aleutian Islands to the Florida Keys, I'm Casey. The countdown continues and doesn't stop until we get to the number best-selling song in the USA this week."

American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This is a recording of a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this broadcast:

There is one act in the countdown who first charted in 1944.

There is a song in the countdown written by a homicide detective and it's the one you'd least expect.

The biggest moving song of the week is by an artist who almost got choked to death on stage by a member of his own cast.

Sylvia is at number nine with her hit, "Pillow Talk." Casey plays a piece of her very first hit song that would later be featured in the motion picture, "Dirty Dancing." 

Stevie Wonder is at number one with "You Are The Sunshine Of My Life" making him only the third male solo singer in the rock era to have back-to-back number one hits; Elvis, and Bobby Vinton being the other two.
